abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Library Development
            Project in Indonesia were as follows: outcomes were
            moderately satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            moderate, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: 1) Libraries have a strategic role
            in promoting student and adult reading habits, interest in
            reading, attainment of student achievement and the
            establishment of a learned society; 2) Library promotion and
            socialization programs, with precise targets, are important
            tools to support library establishment and to gain effective
            support from various parties for the library development; 3)
            Intensive and direct approaches to policy makers, at both
            national and local levels, most often result in more
            effective political and economic support for the library
            development; 4) Informal community leadership can often be
            used to accelerate the acceptance of library development and
            usage in a specific community; 5) Library participation and
            usage will be more significant when library services are
            specifically designed to meet user needs (student, teacher,
            or community); 6) Library team cooperation and transparency
            of library management both enable and increase support and
            participation from various parties during library
            development; 7) The "Block-grant" mechanism is a
            particularly useful financial tool that encourages the
            library manager to learn planning and budgeting principles
            and techniques and to effectively account for library
            expenditures; 8) Field training and on-the-job training
            seems to be more cost effective than formal classroom
            training as approaches to establish/improve library
            management skills of existing staff; 9) Strong, informed
            leadership is a key factor in the dynamics and progress of
            library management at all levels, including the school
            library, community library, and the district public library;
            10) The assignment of management responsibility for district
            and lower level public libraries to local government
            organizations has proven to be an effective approach that
            encourages local governments to assume "ownership"
            of those libraries. This in turn, encourages local
            governments to promote and to finance district and local
            library development where there is a dramatic need for such
            services; 11) Standard expenditure in the project
            allocations are not appropriate given the different
            geographical contexts (more dispersed areas need a greater
            proportion of funds devoted to travel); 12) Community
            libraries are more successful if they also have community
            and recreational areas (e.g. for group meetings, coffee
            houses); 13) Libraries that are more successful are those
            that generally serve their communities and are well managed
            internally. Not all libraries are truly embedded in their
            communities; some are add-ons; 14) Personal contact from
            libraries to district officials can increase support for the
            library. Other initiatives are somewhat useful, although
            largely seen as ineffective since they do not target key
            decision-makers who control financing. These include book
            fairs and outreach activities to communities; and 15)
            Libraries that are only project driven do not succeed. Those
            closely linked to religious institutions or youth groups are
            more successful. Mobile libraries are potentially important
            in getting greater variety of books (one reason why
            libraries are not used is because clients have read all the
            books of interest to them).
